description_txt: stated on November 12, 2010 in a radio show:
quote_txt: "Nobody has played clips over and over ... of President Obama (saying), 'If they bring a knife to the fight, we'll bring a gun.' "

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in in "Fed Up! Our Fight to Save America from Washington":
quote_txt: "The (federal) debt is growing by more than $4 billion a day."

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: "We’ve been able to create about 60,000 net new jobs" in Virginia since February.

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: Milwaukee’s problems include "52 percent black male unemployment."

description_txt: stated on November 5, 2010 in Statements to reporters:
quote_txt: Said they reached a  "power-sharing agreement" with Republican Lt. Gov. Casey Cagle

description_txt: stated on October 7, 2010 in e-mail and blog postings:
quote_txt: The cap-and-trade bill before Congress "prevents you from selling your home without the permission of the EPA administrator."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • November 17, 2010

description_txt: stated on November 14, 2010 in "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: A recent report from the president's deficit commission was "completely empty" on controlling health care costs.

description_txt: stated on November 15, 2010 in a posting on Twitter.:
quote_txt: "Re: (Marco) Rubio's support of earmark ban: In 2002 alone, he requested 37 earmarks worth $43 million."

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in a post-election interview.:
quote_txt: "This is the first time a party has picked up multiple seats during a regular election since the mid 1980s, making this the largest majority of any party in more than 25 years."

description_txt: stated on November 13, 2010:
quote_txt: President Obama, Sen. Harry Reid and Rep. Nancy Pelosi passed a "$1.2 trillion stimulus bill."

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: Sewer backups into basements caused the "vast majority of the damage to homes and buildings" in Milwaukee’s July floods, but federal flood insurance doesn’t cover them.

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2010 in an interview:
quote_txt: "We haven’t had control of the House for the last two years and it’s been malfunctioning. We had 109 sessions scheduled and held 49."

description_txt: stated on November 14, 2010 in an interview with his brother, former President George W. Bush, on CNN.:
quote_txt: "Rick Scott got a majority of the Hispanic vote in Florida."

description_txt: stated on November 14, 2010 in an interview on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: Federal spending is "the highest it's been as a share of our economy in 60 years (and) revenue is the lowest it's been as a share of our economy in 60 years."

description_txt: stated on November 14, 2010 in an interview on CBS' "Face the Nation":
quote_txt: "We now consume at the federal level 25 percent of the gross domestic product. Historically we were at 20 percent. So we've taken 5 percent away from the private sector."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2010 in a news release issued by the group's John Muir chapter in Wisconsin:
quote_txt: If the state turns down money for high-speed rail, it will "kill nearly 10,000 permanent Wisconsin jobs."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2010 in a statement:
quote_txt: Says Fort Hood near Killeen, Texas, is "the largest military installation in the free world."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2010 in a speech to lobbyists:
quote_txt: John Kasich says he won, despite "12 visits by a president, somewhere between $45 (million) and $50 million (spent against him,) 500 paid volunteers in here calling me every name in the book, former presidents, first ladies and God-knows-who-else."

description_txt: stated on November 11, 2010 in n Op/Ed in The Financial Times:
quote_txt: $65 billion "would be added to the deficit if we keep the cuts for people on the highest incomes."

description_txt: stated on November 5, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says Governor-elect Scott Walker’s choice as transition team leader "killed the release of a damaging report on Walker’s record in the days leading up to the election."

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2010 in an interview.:
quote_txt: "Social Security is indeed a Ponzi scheme."

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2010 in a news conference:
quote_txt: Experts say the property tax "is the most harmful to economic growth and . . . the sales tax is least harmful."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • November 14, 2010

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2010 in a statement to Alexandria City Council :
quote_txt: $65 million from ABC privatization will not pay for "even an overpass in Tysons Corner."

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2010 in the college's website:
quote_txt: Portland Community College serves more students than all of the state’s universities combined.

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2010 in an interview on NBC's "Today Show":
quote_txt: "My debt to GDP was the lowest or one of the lowest of modern presidents. My taxes to GDP was the lowest and my spending to GDP" was too.

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: Has created 60,000 net new jobs since taking office.

description_txt: stated on November 10, 2010 in comments on her MSNBC show.:
quote_txt: "The Republican who was just elected governor of the great state of Florida paid his campaign staffers, not with money, but with American Express gift cards."

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: "It is a commitment voters take very seriously: The only incumbent in Ohio to break his Pledge and vote for Ted Strickland's income tax hike was defeated soundly on Tuesday."

description_txt: stated on November 5, 2010 in comments made during adoption of Milwaukee's 2011 city budget:
quote_txt: "Mequon and Milwaukee have the highest disparity of income in the country."

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2010 in a website:
quote_txt: Oregon’s budget has grown by 49 percent in just four years.
